lead_paragraph: The Blue Cut Fire “hit with an intensity that we haven’t seen before,” the San Bernardino County fire chief said.

byline.contributor: Ciaran McEvoy reported from Fontana, and Jess Bidgood from New York. Christopher Mele contributed reporting from New York, and Rebecca Rainey from San Bernardino, Calif.
byline.original: By CIARAN MCEVOY and JESS BIDGOOD

headline.print_headline: 5 Acres One Day, 25,000 the Next: California Fire Upends Lives in a Matter of Hours
headline.main: Southern California Fire Flared Up at 5 Acres. A Day Later, It Covered 25,000.

snippet: The Blue Cut Fire “hit with an intensity that we haven’t seen before,” the San Bernardino County fire chief said....
abstract: Wildfire near San Bernardino, Calif, continues to rage out of control after destroying over 25,000 acres; experienced fire officials say they are surprised by intensity of blaze.
